turns.speaker: CLAY
turns.text: C'mon, champ. You look a little woozy, there.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: This -- ? This is nothing. You know what'll kill me?  Her.

turns.speaker: CLAY
turns.text: They're not speaking. Professor Broom had him grounded.

turns.speaker: CLAY
turns.text: Okay. You saw the fish man, right?

turns.speaker: CLAY
turns.text: He gets fed six times a day. He's got a thing for cats. You'll be his nanny, his keeper, his best friend. He never goes out unsupervised --

turns.speaker: CLAY
turns.text: Yup. Sixty years old by our count. But he doesn't age like we do -- think dog years: He's barely out of his teens.

turns.speaker: CLAY
turns.text: His horns. He files 'em. To "fit in."

turns.speaker: CLAY
turns.text: Not so fast. He barely knows him --

turns.speaker: GRIGORY
turns.text: I sang the first lullaby you ever heard, my child. I ushered you into this world.  I alone know your true calling, your true name.

turns.speaker: GRIGORY
turns.text: Names hold the power and nature of things. Mine for example. Rasputin: "The crossroads."  And crossroads I have become.  Your true name: Anung-un-Rama. Repeat it. Become the key.

turns.speaker: GRIGORY
turns.text: You will never fulfill your destiny. You will never understand the power inside you.

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: But not everyone was so lucky.  Two agents died today. Clay probably won't survive the night. You're reckless.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: I knew those men better than you did --

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: Ah, I see. That makes it all alright then.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: No, it doesn't make it right, but I stopped that creature, didn't I?

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: That's what you do. That's why we need you. You have an insight.  You know monsters.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: What are you trying to say?

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: In the end, after you've killed and captured every freak out there -- there's still one left: you.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: I wish I could be more gracious but --

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: "One falls, two shall arise." So: you pop one, two come out. You kill two, you get four. You kill four, you're in trouble. We have to nail 'em all at once. And the eggs.

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: When we do: No mumbo-jumbo. Double- core Vulcan-65 grenades.

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: We've installed a very handy timer. Set it, walk away. Cable pulls the safety pins, K-boom! Easy to clean, easy to use...

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: Each of us gets a belt.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: I won't take 'em. They never work.

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: We should go back -- you -- you could tear that door apart --

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: I'm in charge. We go back!

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: You'd better stay here. I'll find a way out. We'll come back for you.

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: You call that thing a cigar??

turns.speaker: MANNING
turns.text: You never, ever light a cigar that way.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Those comics -- They never got the eyes right.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Oh. Uh. Hello. I -- I have these. For you.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: No one ever helps me. It's my job.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: My arm is fine. Where are you??

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: I just fried Stinky. Tell Father I'll be home. He shouldn't wait up.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Wait -- Wait -- You can't go anywhere -- I gotta go with you --

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: No, no, no, it's fine: I do my job, I take a break.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: No. Stop. Don't do this -- Listen to me -- Tell me where you are --

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: C'mon, time to go home. Tape you up.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: What are you, a Boy Scout?

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: You want me to hold him down?

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: That's right, Stud, hold me down.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Down there. Did you ever loose track of him?

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Well, let's see -- there was that moment, when I had a train on top of my head --

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Professor, that girl you were talking about --

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: I think I can help -- Talk to her -- I can bring her back.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: What landed you this job, pushing "pamcakes"? Punctuality? What was your area of expertise?

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Myers, you're a talker. What's a good word -- a solid word for "need" --

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Start in, you got nachos coming.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: On a scale of one to ten: two. But --  -- she'll take care of you, Myers. She's a tough one.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Keep her safe. No matter what. I'll deal with whatever's back there.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You better have that looked at.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Just a scratch.  I wanted to see you.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: We miss you at the Bureau. Abe's crazier every day. And Father's still mad at me --  Come back, Liz. Come back. I --

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: No. Not this time, H.B. It's been months since I've had an episode. And you know what? I'm learning to control it.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Um... Liz -- I -- there's something I'd like you to -- something I need you to hear.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Well. Is it long?? I'm going out, but --

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: For a cup of coffee, but go ahead, read.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: It's nothing. Just a list -- It's not finished --

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Oh, okay then. Maybe later then.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I've changed my mind. I'll come to Moscow. If you -- are still going --

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: But I understand what you don't like about me. I do. What I am makes you feel out of place -- out there --

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Listen. I'm not like Myers. He makes you feel like you belong. And -- that's good. It really is. I -- wish I could do something about this --  But I can't.  I can promise you only two things... One: I'll always look this good. Two: I won't give up on you. Ever.

turns.speaker: HELLBOY
turns.text: Okay, someone's expecting us. Turn on your locators -- Anyone sees anything...

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Liz -- can I call you Liz? It's a beautiful name --

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: 60% OF THE WOMEN IN THIS WORLD ARE NAMED "LIZ".

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: It's still impressive by my standards: My name's John.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Dr. Broom asked me to invite you back to the Bureau. No special precautions, no security escorts. You and me in a taxi. Like regular folks.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: Miss Sherman, he's asking you back, but it's entirely your choice.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: I admire him. He's a force of nature.

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: My uncle used to say... we like people for their qualities but love them for their defects.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Don't know. Really. I grew up with him.  I've missed him too, but now, every time I see him, I get confused. Hardly a day goes by he's not in my mind. Even now, I feel he's here --

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: But it's not true, is it?

turns.speaker: MYERS
turns.text: That you feel that way about me.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You want to know -- Now -- ? Here? Red, white, whatever -- Guys are all the same.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Wait! Wait! Watch the fucking paint work.

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Look, do you want the bed in or not?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Who are you calling a fucking ass- hole? It's this bastard bed that's your fucking problem!

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Will you sign for the bed?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Eh, Chas, slow it down like the man says.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Alright, let's give it another try.

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Do you really need this bed, lady?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Damn right. Now are we going to move the bed or not?

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: The box... you opened it. We came.

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: It's a means to summon us -- it's called the Lament Configuration.

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: Cenobites. Explorers in the further regions of experience. Demons to some. Angels to others.

turns.speaker: KIRSTY
turns.text: Well, I didn't mean to open that thing. You can go back wherever you came from.

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: You solved the box. We came. Now you must come with us. Taste our pleasures.

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: He doesn't see us, or hear us. We belong to you, Kirsty. And you to us.

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: No tears please. It's a waste of good suffering.

turns.speaker: KIRSTY
turns.text: To a man called Frank Cotton?

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: Suppose he HAD slipped us. What significance has that?

turns.speaker: KIRSTY
turns.text: I could lead you right to him. You could take him back to Hell instead of me.

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: We want the man who did this --

turns.speaker: KIRSTY
turns.text: Stay the fuck away from me.

turns.speaker: CENOBITE
turns.text: We've got such sights to show you --

turns.speaker: KIRSTY
turns.text: I have to speak to my father.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's easily arranged. But first, back into bed.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You took quite a beating. You must lie down.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: First things first. You can have a telephone when we've talked. Do you know who did this to you?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You were holding onto it like grim death.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well the police are going to want to speak to you. You know that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We'll get you a phone as long as you promise to stay put.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Kirsty. It's Frank. It's Uncle Frank.

turns.speaker: KIRSTY
turns.text: Don't touch me. Or so help me --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What? What will you do? What CAN you do?  There's nothing to be frightened of.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I bet you make your Daddy proud, don't you? Beautiful.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I used to tell myself that. Used to try and pretend I was dreaming all the pain. But why kid yourself? Some things have to be endured. Take it from me. And that makes the pleasures so much sweeter...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: One last time. Give me the box.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Some things have to be endured...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't mourn him. He was dead long before we laid a finger on him.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hush now. It's all right Frank's here.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: That's right. This is Frank you're talking to, remember? FRANK.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: There is going to BE a wedding?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Well can I come in or not?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I'm sorry. Of course. You're very welcome.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I don't want to see the dress.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I don't want to see the dress.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Believe me. It's me. It's really me.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: His blood... on the floor... It brought me back.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Just help, will you? Please God, help me --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You can't let me stay like this. Please. You can't.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: What do you want me to do.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The blood brought me this far. I need more of the same. Or I'll slip back...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: My nerves... are beginning to work again.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: -- to heal me completely. Then we can be away from here, before they come looking.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The Cenobites. It's only a matter of time before they find I've slipped them. I have to get away from here.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Ssh. Don't want babe to hear.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You won't cheat me will you? You'll stay with me. Help me. Then we can be together, the way we were before. We belong to each other now, for better or worse...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Better. Very much better. I'd like something to wear. And some cigarettes. Will you bring me some?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I want an explanation first. I want to know what happened to you.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It's not any box. It's called the Lament Configuration. It's a puzzle.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't touch it. It's dangerous. It opens doors.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: To experience beyond anything ever known. At least that's what I was promised when I bought it. Pleasure from Heaven or Hell. I didn't much care which.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I was bored. I'd done everything. I'd gone to the limits. There was nothing left to experience. At least nothing I could buy on earth.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: And you came back here to solve the puzzle --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Sure. Somewhere safe.  Safe. Christ! They tortured me here. In this room.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The Cenobites. The creatures the box set free.  Sometimes I think they're still here. Just behind the walls. Them and their hooks and their beasts. Just waiting to break out again. Except that I've got the box.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You would be. They tore me apart.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No. They gave me experiences beyond the limits. Pain and pleasure, indivisible.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: They took my body, but my spirit... they left that here. In the boards, in the walls. Watching the world, but not able to TOUCH it.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: And the blood let you out?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It gave me a little chance, and I took it. They won't get me back. I'm going to live, and you're going to help me. Yes?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Then find me somebody else, before they come looking.
